intro: Psittacoglossum soconuscanum, commonly known as the red-tipped nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with reddish veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important plant in its native habitat.
